name: Pacific Shores Inn

reviews.text: See Wacky in Toronto's last paragraph (Sept. 9, 2008)....
reviews.title: Plan to return, great location, Excellent price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not a romantic place, it's a very functional place at a great price in a great location.
reviews.title: OK not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked it solely based on reviews read here. We paid AAA rate of around $90. for week-end and $85. for week days. We had a top floor room (it's a 2 floor motel) with 2 queen beds and a partial view of the ocean (room 35). I booked with the hotel directly and was told that a partial ocean view was their maximum view. This was the case. We stayed 6 nights.
reviews.title: decent motel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our bathroom was completely renovated with a window that opened. Beds were comfortable, Towels & toiletries better than you'd think at this price. A/C noisy but we ran it during the day when we weren't there and turned it off at night. The room had a ceiling fan, which was sufficient. FYI - outiside temperature was around 80 - 90 degrees F. during our stay.
reviews.title: Good but not great...

likes.disliked: — lack of some small ammenities; coffe cups, bath towel hooks, no room safe

reviews.text: We had an outside table with seating. The balcony is like this: a long open area that fronts your room and all the adjoining rooms. If you have one of the first rooms in the row, you will have people walking right past your outside area. If you have the last room in the row, you have total privacy. Each room door is slightly angled so that you don't see your neighbour when sitting outside.
reviews.title: Great location for a young beach/surf loving dude

likes.disliked: — All fast food outlets close by

reviews.text: It's hard to find such a nice place just paces from the beach at such a reasonable rate. I booked through the hotel website and received the most affordable rate with the AAA discount. The rooms were simple but comfortable with updated furniture, fridge/micro, very large flatscreen TV and a walk in shower with bath & body works products. There were 2 queen beds which were very comfortable as well.
reviews.title: Affordable comfort right off the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had an upstairs unit with a partial ocean view. I was traveling solo and had no issues whatsoever. The staff was young, but hospitable. The pool could use a good coat of paint at the bottom (but the beach is right there so who cares!?) and the breakfast was ok...but I'd take breakfast at The Mission over muffins & coffee anyday!
reviews.title: Super Location, Free parking, Great Value

reviews.text: Additional perk: free parking!! Rent a bike for the day and it makes the stay well worth the trip. All in all, a great place for the price, especially with it's close proximity to PB.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in San Diego...just sleep on the beach / plane

reviews.text: I researched Trip Advisor as well as other internet reviews to find a hotel at a reasonable rate that offered location, amenities (microwave, refrigerator, iron) and also positive feedback on cleanliness. I also found that most of the lodging facilities in the area charged up to $20 a day for parking. We found what we were looking for at the Pacific Shores Inn. I made reservations in January and called twice before we arrived to make sure they could accommodate my second floor request as far away from the main road and closer towards the beach as possible. We checked in around 2 p.m. on Tuesday and were told our room was on the first floor. I reminded the clerk, who was extremely friendly, that I had requested otherwise. She then offered us a room on the second floor - but it was on the end right next to the road. She stated this was all they had available. I was quite disappointed and respectfully asked why my request hadn't been granted. She went to the back and spoke with someone and then offered to upgrade us. We were put on the 2nd floor about 2/3 the way down from the road. The room was very nice! Quite large with cathedral ceiling, lovely color scheme, comfortable beds, new flatscreen tv, floor to ceiling glass doors of which the ocean could be seen. The shower stall was exactly as reported on this web site; new but only half enclosed by glass and yes the water did spray all over the floor after showering. Just be sure to lay down a towel. :) We had no problems with any noise - and I am a VERY light sleeper.
reviews.title: Don't! Manager, Jim Silver, gave our reserved room away before check-in time.

reviews.text: Now for the nitty gritty...the carpet had several large dark stains and was dirty enough to discolor white sox. Nothing a good shampooing couldn't cure. There was no where to put your toiletries in the shower except on the floor. Perhaps some wire shelf hangers to slip over the shower nozzle could be purchased? And twice the maid had left our fresh towels sitting on the toilet which was rather unpleasant. The other 3 times they were hung and fanned out. As for the pool; we would not swim - nor did we see anyone else swim - as there was a significant amount of algae on the bottom.
reviews.title: Nice get away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is very close to the beach, you can go there with the surfboard under the arm. Very clean room and bathroom, with kitchen (fridge, freezer, oven). There is a pool. Small take-away breakfast. We stayed few days, before travelling back to Italy. It was the last period of our holiday and we run out of the credit card limit. Of course we payed in cash, but the owner of the inn was very brute with this, leading us to be quite anxious. For this reason we do not suggest this inn to a friend.
reviews.title: not cheap but good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at Pacific Shores Inn. We found the location excellent being very close to the beach.There were many shops, restaurants and public transport within a short walking distance.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The noise from the second story rooms could clearly be heard in the downstairs rooms. Fortunately we had quiet people above us most of the time.
reviews.title: Great hotel - great value for beach location!

reviews.text: There was a great continental breakfast of coffee, juice and Danish pastries included in the price.
reviews.title: Great location and staff

reviews.text: The rooms were spacious and clean.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surpised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found this hotel thru a pet friendly hotel site. I chose this hotel coz i have a puppy with me. I was told on the phone that a $50.00 deposit was required. But when I got there, they charged me $200.00 for deposit plus payment for the room. I told the concierge that i was told it was only $50.00, but that was not the case, a deposit of $200.00 was required. The room was clean. The downside is there is no Wifi. Cable tv channels are very limieted. No HBO, but HBO was listed in their channels offered. I would never stay here again. The staff is incompetent.
reviews.title: Not all that....

reviews.text: We stayed three nights in January 2009. The positives: good location, free parking, friendly staff, very easy beach access, rooms clean, big (30"+) flat screen tv, bathroom recently remodeled, free coffee, juice, and muffins in the lobby each morning. Now it's time to get nitpicky: room 28. Two light switches at front door, could not figure out what they controlled.They did nothing each time I flipped them in either direction. Electrical outlet under view window: dead. Light switch in large walk-in closet did not work. Floor lamp in closet worked if you unplugged the microwave or refrigerator in there. Coffee maker in closet, but never received coffee, filters or cups (so why bother putting a coffee maker in the room?) There were four items in the closet that needed electricity, but only two outlets. Bathroom newly remodeled and nicely tiled, but shower head was mounted at least 10 inches too low and room had a strong mildew smell that did not go away. The two beds in the room did not seem to be queen sized. More likely full size, so you will be very snug sharing the bed.
reviews.title: Mostly positive

likes.disliked: — Minor, nitpicky issues showing a lack of attention to details by management.

reviews.text: So there are details that the management needs to work on, but even with all of the minor annoyances I would still stay here again. Good value for the price and location.
reviews.title: Value for money

likes.liked: — Value for money, size of room and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend and I stayed here for 3 nights as part of a road trip around California.
reviews.title: Good quite location, standard accommodation

likes.liked: — The cooking facilities and fridge and the location because it's not in the hussle bussle area
likes.disliked: — They clean spotlessly every day but the cleaning detergent smells a bit too strong and lingers a while

reviews.text: The main reason for booking was for the beach and price, given how expensive accommodation is in downtown San Diego and we were on a budget. We weren't disappointed as the room was clean and a decent size, with 2 queen beds, table/chairs and sofa plus a small kitchen. There is also a small on-site self service laundrette which was handy. Therefore you would be comfortable staying for a longer period of time if need be.
reviews.title: Was Very Good

likes.liked: — great value for money and the location
likes.disliked: — the stairs to get to the room

description: The Pacific Shores Inn is a quaint inn located at the north end of Pacific Beach. Many of the rooms offer some views of the ocean, and restaurants and shops are just a couple of blocks away. The boardwalk is a 2.5 mile stretch that will take you from the north end of Pacific Beach all the way to the south end of Mission Beach. As you stroll down the boardwalk, you will find ocean front shops and restaurants as well as the famous Belmont Park in Mission Beach. Bike, and surfboard rentals are located within two blocks so there is no reason to pack those items when visiting us. And, every room has a microwave oven, refrigerator, and a coffee maker for your convenience. Some rooms also have full kitchens for those who require that. Parking, and a continental breakfast which includes juice, coffee, and danish are always free.
